questions.question_text:
A SysOps Administrator is running an automatically scaled application behind an Application Load Balancer. Scaling out is triggered when the CPUUtilization instance metric is more than 75% across the Auto Scaling group. The Administrator noticed aggressive scaling out. Developers suspect an application memory leak that is causing aggressive garbage collection cycles.
How can the Administrator troubleshoot the application without triggering the scaling process?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
By suspending the scaling process, the Administrator can prevent the Auto Scaling group from triggering scaling actions based on the CPUUtilization metric while troubleshooting the application. This allows the Administrator to investigate the suspected memory leak and perform necessary diagnostics without unnecessary interference from the scaling process.
A is correct: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/ec2/userguide/as-suspend-resume-processes.html#as-suspend-resume
